intro: Canthium barbatum var. christianii, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree. The plant features palmate leaves with lobes that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and riverbanks.
